keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, resulting in his death from injuries sustained during the attack.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though Kieffer and Galliher were acquitted of second-degree gang assault and Kieffer faced a false instrument charge.

The body-camera footage of the beating—silent but showing guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck—was pivotal in the prosecution’s case and revealed a lack of concern among the guards.
The incident demonstrated a pattern of misconduct in correctional facilities, with multiple guards indicted and some pleading guilty to lesser charges, while others are still under investigation.

Special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick led the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to civil lawsuits involving prison officers, indicating potential conflicts of interest in state law enforcement.

Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2024, beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, showing a systemic concern about prison violence and officer accountability.
Brooks had a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault and was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility that night, suggesting possible vulnerabilities in inmate transfer protocols.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and manslaughter in the fatal beating of inmate Robert Brooks at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. Brooks, who had been transferred from another prison, was attacked multiple times upon arrival, with the final beating in the infirmary captured on silent body-camera footage showing guards punching, stomping, and lifting him by the neck. Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with similar offenses. The prosecution, led by Onondaga County District Attorney William Fitzpatrick—who took over after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to civil lawsuits—argued that the guards acted as a gang with a depraved indifference to human life. The case has drawn national attention due to the graphic video evidence and raises concerns about systemic violence and accountability in correctional facilities. A separate case involving the beating death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility is also being prosecuted by Fitzpatrick, indicating a broader pattern of misconduct in New York prisons.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
